citation.article-title: Taxonomic dissection of the genus Micrococcus: Kocuria gen. nov., Nesterenkonia gen. nov., Kytococcus gen. nov., Dermacoccus gen. nov., and Micrococcus Cohn 1872 gen. emend.

p.s: Nesterenkonia (Ne.ste.renk0’ni.a. L. fem. n. Nesterenkonia, honoring Olga Nesterenko, a Ukrainian microbiologist)
The description of Nesterenkonia below is based on data from references 25,24,36,45, and 46 and this study.
The peptidoglycan type is type L-Lys-Gly-Glu, variation A4α.
Menaquinones with eight and nine completely unsaturated isoprene units (MK-8 and MK-9) predominate.
The phospholipids are diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylglycerol, and phosphatidylinositol.
The cellular fatty acids are iso- and anteiso-branched fatty acids, with anteiso-C15:0) and anteiso-C17:0 predominating.
The G+C content of the DNA is 70 to 72 mol%.
The type species is Nesterenkonia halobia.
